u1fb2.La Basilica di Santa Maria in via Lata è: The Basilica Santa Maria in via Lata preserves the memory of an important piece of the two thousand year history of Christianity in the Eternal City.

u2248.Il Carcer Tullianum, uno dei monumenti a: The Carcer Tullianum is one of the most fascinating archeological monuments from the era of the Roman republic. It contains a wealth of art, archeology and history. It has also become a place of Christian worship, and is situated beneath the church of Saint Joseph of the Carpenters. And seeing that it faces the Roman Forum, it offers one of the most evocative views of ancient Rome. With the assistance of some of the most recent technologies, you will discover the place where, according to tradition, Saint Peter was imprisoned.

u1f8e.Il Carcer Tullianum, la prigione di mass: Carcer Tullianum: the maximum security prison of ancient Rome where enemies of state were imprisoned; Colosseum: where cruel games of Imperial Rome were held; Roman Forum: the social, commercial and religious hub of ancient Rome from the first pages of its history; Palatine Hill, place where this city was born around the middle of the eighth century BC.
u1f8e.Questa visita vi porterà ad ammirare l’e: During this visit you will be able to admire the exceptional stratification of history
u1f8e.storiche e artistiche che testimoniano l: and art that give witness to the life and development of ancient Rome.

u24b9.Questa visita vi porterà ad ammirare l’e: During this visit, you will be able to admire the exceptional historical stratification, which tells us about every day life in ancient Rome and its development over time.
u24b9.Il Carcer Tullianum, la prigione di mass: Carcer Tullianum: the maximum security prison of ancient Rome where enemies of state were imprisoned; Colosseum: where cruel games of Imperial Rome were held; Roman Forum: the social, commercial and religious hub of ancient Rome from the first pages of its history; Palatine Hill, place where this city was born around the middle of the eighth century BC.

u27e0.Basilica di S. Maria in Via Lata: Basilica Santa Maria in Via Lata

u28e8.Le Catacombe sono “un mondo segreto che: The Catacombs are “a secret world that opens to pilgrims and tourists a world of artistic beauty and of faith in memory of so many people that believed in Christ and in his word of hope”.

u26a8.Le Catacombe di Roma sono caratterizzate: The Catacombs of Rome are a network of tunnels carved out of tuff, at times on several levels. As you progress through this network of corridors, rooms and underground halls, you will be inevitably taken in not only by evocative scenes both from the Bible and from every day life in Rome, but also by a world of symbols, some of which are painted as frescoes, others which are carved into the stone as graffiti.

u3026.Un ingresso a scelta tra le Catacombe di: One entrance of your choice to the Catacombs of Rome

u2fb3.Roma, cuore della Cristianità, è una cit: Rome is not only a city laden with historical charm, museums, and churches, but it's the very heart of Christendom.
u2fb3.Se vuoi organizzare la tua visita in man: An Omnia Card will help you optimize your experience in Rome, making it that much more simple to organize your visits in an inexpensive manner.
u2fb3.In funzione del tempo a tua disposizione: According to the amount of time you have to spend, you can choose between the 24h card and the 72h card, both of which include a number of services.

u30cc.Se il tuo soggiorno a Roma è breve, sceg: If your stay in Rome is a short one, you can choose the Omnia Card 24 hours to accompany your unforgettable experience, allowing you to discover the treasures of Rome with numerous concessions and favorable conditions.

u303d.Rendi il tuo soggiorno a Roma un’esperie: Your stay in Rome can become an unforgettable experience using the Omnia Card 72 hours. In addition to offering a wide choice of Vatican&Rome services, you also get a “Rome Pass”, the card of the city of Rome that gives access to over 40 archaeological sites and museums within the city as well as to public transportation (both subway and buses).

u29c3.CASA DEL VESCOVO DI ROMA: HOUSE OF THE BISHOP OF ROME

u2a5e.Tutti i giorni tranne mercoledì, domenic: Every day except Wednesday, Sunday and religious holidays

u29d9.Il Palazzo Lateranense, sede papale e re: The Lateran Palace was the official residence of the popes for many centuries. Considering its history, it has a lot to offer from an artistic, cultural and religious point of view. Here each room you visit has frescoed vaults, magnificent ceilings, fine tapestries, and paintings by great masters. You can also find fine antique furniture, for example in the private Papal apartment. This visit is an opportunity to experience and learn about both the history of the Church and that of the city of Rome. Quite a bit to appreciate from the Lateran Palace!

u2bd4.Chiostro della Basilica di San Giovanni: Cloister of the Basilica of Saint John Lateran

u2d1a.Un percorso autentico nel cuore della Ci: An authentic journey into the heart of the City. You'll be able to hop on and off at any of the stops along the way, strategically placed in the most interesting areas of the city. A multi-language audio guide will assist in enriching your knowledge of Rome's history and of its wonders.
u2d1a.La città di Roma è un museo a cielo aper: The city of Rome is an open air museum, which you can explore in relaxation while you take in the amazing view, on board the Vatican&Rome Open Bus.

u2ec6.Omnia è la City Card di Roma e della Cit: Omnia is the City Card of Rome and Vatican City: with museums, monuments, transportation, priority entry and a plethora of other advantages, all in a single card.

u2e74.Omnia Vatican &amp; Romeè l’unico pass u: Omnia Vatican & Rome is the only official pass to see Rome and the Vatican

u13e6.I Giardini Vaticani occupano circa due t: The Vatican Gardens occupy about two thirds of the surface area of Vatican City, and have been a place where the Popes have gone to relax and meditate since the year 1279. You can admire the natural beauty and architectural wonders of the Vatican Gardens with a guided visit. Or, you can choose to have your visit in an unprecedented and sustainable fashion: on board a panoramic minibus where the silence of the "green heart" of the Vatican will permeate an evocative tour along paths of art, nature, and faith.

u1368.<a id=\"u6b77\" title=\"PRENOTA LA TUA V: RESERVE YOUR VISIT

u10c5.I Musei Vaticani, da sempre considerati: You will be surprised by the cultural treasures that can be found in the Vatican Museums, which have always been considered one of the most important museum institutions in the world. Not only can you visit the exclusive art collections, archaeological artefacts, and items of ethnographic interest, but you can also visit some of the more significant areas of the Apostolic Palaces which contain some of the most famous artistic masterpieces of all times and some of the greatest treasures of the past.

u16f6.Incantevoli in qualsiasi periodo dell’an: Enchanting at any time of the year, the Pontifical Villas of Castel Gandolfo are a unique balance between nature and art. Come appreciate the treasures that the Gardens of the Pontifical Villas offer. Together with Villa Cybo and Villa Barberini, the Castel Gandolfo Residence forms the complex of Pontifical Villas with their splendid gardens and marvelous park.
u16f6.Sarà inoltre possibile ammirare il Palaz: Admire the Apostolic Palace, which for centuries was used as a summer residence of the Popes, and is now a museum. Take a journey through time as you admire the paintings, the relics, the liturgical garb and the uniforms.

u3372.Lontano dal clamore dei siti più conosci: Far from the clamor of the more famous sites, you can also discover a less well known Rome with hidden corners and alternate routes compared to the traditional ones. Take a stroll to discover hidden jewels both in and around the city center. Hear stories and untold peculiarities about churches, museums, districts, parks, basilicas, basements and terraces.

u3307.Vivi Roma attraverso le sue strade e vic: Experience Rome in all its nooks and crannies

u3403.La visita ripercorrerà le testimonianze: Retrace the steps traced in ages past by the Roman Emperors, discover the traces left by the Christian martyrs, and follow in the footsteps of so many Saints who have walked before us in these same streets. Contemplate the stories of the Gospel and of those who put it into practice in a heroic manner, as told by the works of art and by the architectural masterpieces.
u3403.Nel cuore di Roma si intrecciano luoghi: In the heart of Rome, artistic beauty and spiritual afflatus join together.

u365b.Roma è custode anche della memoria di av: Rome preserves the memory of Gospel events through so many relics kept in various basilicas and churches. Discover the most significant Christian relics along a path that starts at the Basilica of Holy Cross in Jerusalem and ends at the Basilica of Saint Mary Major. Relive events from the life of Jesus and of the Apostles. Get a taste of the Holy Land here in Rome, in anticipation of an actual pilgrimage to the places of the Gospel in the Holy Land.

u3896.L’itinerario pone l’attenzione su alcune: The focus of this itinerary is on those icons revered over the centuries by the Roman people, that are among the oldest extant icons in the world, and are often considered to have somewhat of a miraculous nature, or to tell a story that is none less than miraculous. Take a journey through faith and devotion. As objects of devotion, the icons have been carried in procession, invoked for healing, and still today are a living memory of Mary, Mother of us all, and of Jesus, son of God and son of Mary. At Santa Maria in via Lata, we will remember Saint Luke who dwelled there, and who was the first iconographer in history. At Santa Maria in Aracoeli, we will invoke the Madonna Advocata. At Santa Francesca Romana we will pay homage to the oldest known marian icon, “Our Lady of Comfort”. And last but not least, we will meet the patroness of Rome, Mary “Salus Populi Romani” in the Basilica of Saint Mary Major, whom the Popes themselves greet before and after their journeys abroad.

u19d6.La magnifica facciata del ‘700 di Carlo: The magnificent 18th century façade by Carlo Maderno and the Colonnade by Bernini symbolically embrace pilgrims arriving in the Eternal City. The embrace of Saint Peter's Basilica welcomes you for your visit as you come and discover the endless history of faith and charitable works.
u19d6.Attraverso un percorso di arte, fede e s: Admire not only the magnificence of the building and the beauty of the artwork, but come follow along a path of faith and spirituality. As you walk through the naves of the Basilica, stop to visit the side chapels and listen to the Gospel message that the works of art convey. As for example Michelangelo's Pietà, which not only is a masterpiece of all time, but also assists us in contemplating the Paschal mystery.
